title: Cyclone Montha: Flights & trains cancelled, red alert issued as 3 states brace for landfall — key points
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada tonight, bringing heavy rains and winds up to 110 kmph to Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and northern Tamil Nadu. Authorities have initiated massive evacuations, deployed rescue teams, and are preparing for potential power and communication disruptions.

title: Strongest storm in 174 yrs: Video captures lightning flashes within eye of Hurricane Melissa - Watch
content: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa has stunned the world with jaw-dropping videos from its eye, captured by U.S. Air Force "Hurricane Hunters." The storm made landfall in Jamaica, bringing devastating winds and flooding, prompting the Prime Minister to call it the island's most violent in recorded history. Cuba and the Bahamas are now bracing for its impact.

title: Cracks in INDIA bloc? SP MLA questions Rahul‘s Jan Nayak’ title; prefers Akhilesh Yadav
content: Samajwadi Party MLA Ravidas Mehrotra criticized the Congress for calling Rahul Gandhi 'jan nayak,' asserting that the INDIA bloc will collectively decide on leadership. This statement comes amid a political row in Bihar over the title 'Jan Nayak,' with parties clashing over its use for Karpoori Thakur and Rahul Gandhi.

title: 30,000 layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
content: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: Shreyas Iyer injured: Surya provides update; India prepares for T20I series
content: Shreyas Iyer is recovering well in Sydney after a spleen injury sustained during a catch in the third ODI against Australia. Captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Iyer is responding and medically stable, though he will be monitored. This unfortunate incident casts doubt on his availability for the upcoming South Africa series, impacting India's middle-order plans.

title: Auqib Nabi's story: Father wanted him to be a doctor; 'qismat' changed plans
content: From curfew-hit Baramulla to tormenting batters in domestic cricket, Auqib Nabi’s rise has been nothing short of inspirational. The bowler who once borrowed spikes for trials, now dreams of donning India colours. Mentored by Irfan Pathan and inspired by Parvez Rasool, Nabi’s story is a tale of perseverance, patience, and unwavering belief in destiny

title: Did Dodgers-Blue Jays showdown set record for longest game in World Series history?
content: The 2025 World Series saw the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays engage in a grueling 16-inning Game 3, marking the second-longest World Series game ever. This marathon contest at Dodger Stadium followed the record-setting 18-inning Game 3 from 2018, also featuring the Dodgers, solidifying their place in baseball's endurance history.

title: Google denies Gmail passwords leak; calls it ‘inaccurate’, blames data mix-up
content: Google has refuted claims of a massive Gmail data breach, stating that millions of accounts remain secure. The company clarified that reports likely stem from a misunderstanding of "infostealer" databases, not a targeted attack. Google urged users to enable two-step verification and adopt passkeys for enhanced account safety.

title: Bengaluru horror: Delivery agent molests Brazilian model; held
content: A 22-year-old grocery delivery agent was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly sexually harassing a Brazilian model at her city flat. The accused, Kumar, touched the woman inappropriately while delivering groceries. The incident was confirmed by CCTV footage, leading to his arrest and judicial custody.

title: 'Everything is true': Japan's ex-PM killer pleads guilty; blames Abe for family's financial ruin
content: Tetsuya Yamagami admitted to the murder of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, stating "Everything is true" during his trial. Yamagami blamed Abe for supporting the Unification Church, which he accused of financially ruining his family. The assassination exposed deep ties between the ruling party and the church, leading to a collapse in public trust.

title: 5 morning habits that can quietly harm your kidneys, according to experts
content: Morning habits like not drinking water, holding your bladder, taking painkillers on an empty stomach, skipping rehydration after exercise, and skipping breakfast can silently harm your kidneys. These seemingly small actions put significant stress on these vital organs over time, impacting their ability to filter waste and maintain overall health.

title: ChatGPT Go subscription now free: Offer starts November 4; Who are eligible users
content: OpenAI is making its ChatGPT Go subscription free for all Indian users for a year, starting November 4. This strategic move targets India, the company's second-largest and fastest-growing market, in response to aggressive user acquisition by rivals Google and Perplexity.

title: Student suicides in India: SC’s 8-week compliance clock; can campuses heal?
content: The Supreme Court has given states and the Centre eight weeks to report on student mental health guideline enforcement. This directive follows a rise in student suicides, highlighting a mental health crisis. Coaching centres must now register and provide student support. The Court expects tangible progress by January 2026, aiming for a nationwide law on student well-being.

title: Tata Trusts tussle: Majority votes for Mehli Mistry’s ouster; once Ratan Tata’s close aide
content: Mehli Mistry's tenure as a trustee at Tata Trusts appears to be ending as key figures Noel Tata, Venu Srinivasan, and Vijay Singh have not approved his term extension. This decision, made by a majority of trustees, signals a significant shift within the prestigious Tata group.

title: 'How long have you known?': King Charles heckled, questioned on Prince Andrew - Watch
content: During a cathedral visit, King Charles faced a heckler questioning his knowledge of Prince Andrew's Epstein connections. The protester's shouts intensified following renewed scrutiny over Andrew's past and Giuffre's memoir. Despite the disruption, the King continued greeting royal fans, ignoring the disruptive individual.

title: Delhi pollution: Hourly update on AQI returns after glitch; air quality remains 'very poor'
content: Delhi's air quality remained in the 'very poor' category with an AQI of 301, marred by technical glitches that disrupted data updates. Despite the smog, stubble burning contributed minimally. Authorities are now planning cloud seeding to induce artificial rain amid forecasts of light showers, hoping to improve the air.

title: Hit by US sanctions, Russia’s Lukoil to sell overseas assets; why was it targeted?
content: Russian oil giant Lukoil is divesting its international operations following US sanctions imposed due to Moscow's actions in Ukraine. The sanctions, which freeze US assets and bar American firms from doing business with Lukoil and Rosneft, have prompted the company to begin selling its global assets. This move comes as peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine remain stalled.

title: ‘No Muslims in Mustafabad’: Yogi announces renaming village to Kabir Dham; cites heritage restoration
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced that Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri will be renamed Kabir Dham after learning no Muslim families reside there. He stated the renaming aims to restore the village's heritage, contrasting it with past name changes he deemed religiously motivated. The proposal for the renaming is being expedited.

title: Hurricane Melissa unleashes fury: Strongest storm of 2025; Caribbean on edge
content: Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm with winds nearing 280 km/h, is threatening Jamaica with catastrophic flooding and storm surges. The "potentially catastrophic" cyclone underwent explosive intensification due to exceptionally warm ocean waters. Authorities have ordered evacuations and closed airports as the storm inches closer to the island's southern coast.

title: US-India ties: Ex-US commerce secretary slams Trump’s approach; calls it 'big mistake'
content: Former US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo criticized Donald Trump's "America First" policies, warning that the US is alienating allies and making a mistake with India. She argued that an isolationist approach weakens US global influence and that other nations, like China, are actively filling the void left by American disengagement.

title: 7 months pregnant Delhi cop lifts 145kg in weightlifting championship - watch
content: Delhi Police constable Sonika Yadav, seven months pregnant, won a bronze medal at the All India Police Weightlifting Cluster. She lifted a combined 145 kg, concealing her pregnancy until her final deadlift. Her achievement highlights courage and consistency, proving determination can overcome barriers.

title: Charlie Kirk’s daughter spots her late father’s poster in emotional video
content: A touching Instagram video shared by Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, shows their three-year-old daughter joyfully recognizing her late father's poster. The innocent exclamation, "I see Daddy!" resonated globally, highlighting love's enduring power. Erika reflected on how their daughter embodies Charlie's legacy, proving that love transcends loss and lives on through children.

title: Punjabi-Canadian businessman shot dead: Killer waited in parked car; cops call it targeted attack
content: Prominent Punjabi-Canadian businessman Darshan Singh Sahsi, 68, was fatally shot outside his Abbotsford home on Monday morning. Sahsi, president of global clothing recycler Canam International, was ambushed by a shooter waiting in a parked car. The investigation is ongoing, with the Major Crime Unit transitioning the case to IHIT.

title: Toria Aronoff Schottenstein honors stepbrother Ben Bader after tragic death
content: Popular American YouTuber and motivational creator Ben Bader has died in a sudden accident, reportedly a freak sauna incident. His stepsister confirmed his passing, remembering him as a kind soul who inspired thousands with his messages of hope and purpose. Bader's digital legacy, known as "The Ben Effect," continues to impact fans worldwide.

title: 'Be lenient... it's India': Ex-match referee alleges politics at ICC
content: Former match referee Chris Broad has alleged the ICC instructed him to be lenient with India on over-rate offences during his 21-year tenure. He recalled a specific instance where he was pressured to adjust timings for India, citing political influence and India's growing control over the governing body.

title: Twist in Delhi acid attack case: DU girl’s father held; 'toilet cleaner' angle being probed
content: A shocking twist has emerged in the alleged acid attack case of a DU student. Police arrested the girl's father, Akil Khan, for fabricating the incident to frame a suspect whose wife had accused him of sexual assault and blackmail. Inconsistencies in the student's account and the father's confession suggest she may have self-inflicted the burns.

title: Gold price prediction: Why are gold prices under pressure and what's the outlook?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are expected to face pressure ahead of the Trump-Xi meeting due to trade deal optimism, though key issues remain unresolved. Analysts suggest accumulating gold on dips, targeting $5,000 by 2026. Silver also shows vulnerability but presents a buying opportunity for the medium to long term.

title: Prithvi Shaw scripts Ranji history with double century: Check all records he broke
content: Prithvi Shaw has made an immediate impact for Maharashtra, smashing a sensational 222 off 156 balls in his second Ranji Trophy outing. This blistering knock is the second-fastest double century in the tournament's Elite Group history and the fastest in the 21st century. Shaw's performance marks a significant personal comeback and places him among India's elite batsmen.

title: Chhath Puja: PM Modi greets devotees; 4-day festival concludes
content: Chhath Puja concluded nationwide with the morning 'Usha Arghya' to the Sun God, marking the end of the four-day festival. Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended warm wishes, praising community participation and the rigorous fasts observed by devotees. He highlighted the unique tradition of offering prayers to the setting sun, wishing for universal welfare, happiness, and prosperity.

title: Will banks remain closed on October 28? Check state-wise list
content: Banks in Bihar and Jharkhand are closed on October 28 for Chhath Puja, while other regions remain open. Online banking and digital platforms are still accessible for transactions. Additionally, banks in Gujarat will be closed on October 31 for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's birth anniversary.

title: Cyclone Montha: Storm set to hit Andhra coast tonight; Odisha, TN brace for heavy rain
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, with wind speeds reaching 100 kmph. Coastal districts are on high alert, with relief centers established and evacuation efforts underway, including pregnant women. Neighboring Odisha and Tamil Nadu are also bracing for heavy rainfall and strong winds as the storm progresses.

title: Hubble and ground telescopes capture first multi-temp plasma eruption from young star
content: Astronomers have witnessed a young star, EK Draconis, unleash a powerful, multi-temperature plasma eruption, offering a rare glimpse into our Sun's violent early years. This cosmic tantrum, similar to what our Sun experienced billions of years ago, could have profoundly shaped early planetary atmospheres and potentially sparked life on Earth.

title: 'Wanted in many cases': Notorious Bishnoi gang member held in US; was under radar for long
content: Rajasthan's anti-gangster task force, in collaboration with US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, detained Jagdeep Singh, alias Jagga, a key operative of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, near the US-Canada border. Jagga is wanted in over a dozen cases in Rajasthan and Punjab for serious criminal activities, including attempted murder.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex above 84,800
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 25,900, BSE Sensex was down over 500 points.

title: Shreyas Iyer update from Sydney: Why he was rushed to ICU, and family travel plan
content: Team India's Shreyas Iyer is in Sydney's ICU after a severe fall during an ODI match. His vitals dropped dangerously low due to a suspected splenic rupture causing internal bleeding. Iyer is recovering, with his family being arranged to join him. The BCCI is closely monitoring his condition.

title: Why QTCinderella faces backlash over Twitch stream racism and homophobia
content: Popular streamer QTCinderella is facing significant backlash after defending friendships with individuals accused of racism and homophobia. Her comments, suggesting kindness to a hateful person doesn't equate to agreement, ignited a fierce online debate. While some defended her, others accused her of enabling harmful behavior, leading to a fellow streamer distancing herself.

title: ‘Golden Age’: US, Japan sign agreement on 'securing' supply of rare earths — message to Xi?
content: The United States and Japan have signed a critical minerals and rare earths deal, aiming to reduce dependence on China. This agreement, part of a broader Indo-Pacific strategy, signals a coordinated effort to diversify supply chains and bolster alliances amid global resource competition. The pact underscores a commitment to strengthening bilateral relations and enhancing economic security.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Rohit Sharma will retire after 2027 World Cup,' says childhood coach
content: Rohit Sharma's childhood coach, Dinesh Lad, revealed the star opener plans to retire after the 2027 ODI World Cup. This comes after Sharma's match-winning century against Australia. Lad also praised Virat Kohli's resilience, noting their progress towards Sachin Tendulkar's records. Both players are now set for the upcoming series against South Africa.

title: Sugar, honey, or monk fruit: Which is healthier, according to a nutritionist
content: Sweeteners spark debate: nutritionist Suman Agarwal clarifies options beyond sugar. While jaggery and honey offer some benefits, they aren't calorie-free. Dates are a good choice in moderation. Zero-calorie stevia and monk fruit are safer alternatives to artificial sweeteners. Ultimately, limiting all added sugars, even healthier ones, is key for long-term health, according to WHO guidelines and studies.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for October 28 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations:Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Union Bank of India and Multi Commodity Exchange of India (MCX). Both stocks have shown positive technical indicators, breaking out of consolidation and resuming uptrends, with specific buy ranges, stop losses, and targets provided.

title: Magnitude 6.1 earthquake hits western Turkey; buildings collapse
content: A magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck western Turkey, causing three previously damaged buildings to collapse in Sindirgi, Balikesir province. The tremor, felt across multiple provinces, injured 22 people, primarily from panic-related falls. Authorities provided shelter for residents fearing aftershocks, as the region continues to experience seismic activity.

title: How a Rs 20 samosa habit can lead to a Rs 3 lakh angioplasty: Doctor warns of real cost
content: A Delhi cardiologist's viral post highlights how daily Rs 20 samosas can lead to a Rs 3 lakh angioplasty, urging preventive health.  He explains that small, unhealthy choices accumulate, causing long-term heart damage and significant financial strain.  The message resonates with working professionals, emphasizing that proactive healthy habits are far more cost-effective than future medical interventions.

title: Tariff row: China warns against 'law of jungle' ahead of Trump–Xi meet; wants 'free trade system'
content: Chinese Premier Li Qiang warned against rising unilateralism and protectionism in global trade at the ASEAN Summit, urging nations to support free trade. His remarks precede a crucial meeting between US President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, where both leaders are expected to discuss easing ongoing trade disputes and averting further tariffs.

title: Cyclone Montha: Thailand names storm; IMD outlines naming rules
content: “The IMD announces the names once the wind speed of the cyclone reaches 65 kmh,” senior meteorologist Kumar told The Hindu

title: Setting up early warning in the Himalaya poses unique challenges
content: Climate change and development have made the Himalayas acutely vulnerable to floods, landslides and lakebursts, killing hundreds. Why are early warning systems not a priority?

title: Montha cyclone: Nine trains originating in Visakhapatnam cancelled on October 28
content: Passengers and the general public are advised to check with respective railway inquiry offices or in official website for the latest updates on train operations

title: Cyclone Montha brings widespread, intense downpour over north Tamil Nadu
content: RMC issues orange alert for Tiruvallur district; weather system expected to cross Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam on Tuesday night

title: HAL and Russia’s UAC join hands for production of civil jet SJ-100
content: Under the arrangement, HAL will have the rights to manufacture SJ-100 aircraft for domestic customers.

title: Odisha Chief Minister takes part in Chhath Puja celebrations with devotees
content: “Praying to ‘Chhathi Maiya’ and Sun god for the prosperity of the State, happiness, and peace of all the people of Odisha. May everyone's life be auspicious in this great festival of social harmony,” says CM Mohan Charan Majhi

title: Montha cyclone damages two roads in Andhra’s Bapatla district
content: Further, more than 5,407 people were shifted into 119 cyclone rehabilitation centres in Bapatla district

title: Major bureaucratic reshuffle in West Bengal ahead of SIR; DMs, SDOs transferred
content: While the ruling dispensation has termed this reshuffle as routine, BJP alleged “violation of the ECI guidelines”

title: Controversial Kerala Prisons dept letter on ‘release’ of T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case convicts sparks political row
content: Letter seeks a report on potential security issues central to ‘possible release on parole’ of CPI(M) ‘activists’ serving time for 2012 murder of RMP leader

title: Workers unions, political parties welcome Supreme Court order on resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: Paschim Banga Khet Majoor Samity, a union of agricultural workers that has approached the Courts over resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal, said that the Supreme Court order marks a decisive victory for Bengal’s rural workers and a resounding affirmation that the Right to Work cannot be denied or delayed

title: Cyclone Montha: Life thrown out of gear in Vizianagaram, Srikakulam districts
content: Most people remained indoors with the fear of the cyclonic storm which had already caused damage to standing crops and roads

title: Watch: Cyclone Montha to hit Andhra Coast tonight | Red alert in 16 districts
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam near Kakinada tonight as a severe cyclonic storm. The IMD has issued a red alert for 16 districts in Andhra Pradesh, warning of winds up to 110 kmph and heavy rainfall. Thousands have been evacuated, and CM Chandrababu Naidu has ordered zero-casualty preparedness.

title: APSSDC announces overseas placements for Mechatronics technicians in Germany
content: Selected candidates will be offered employment in Germany with a monthly salary of approximately Euro 2,500 to Euro 3,000, along with 30 days paid leave and a 2-year contract

title: SIR in West Bengal: Booth Level Officers call for added security measures against ‘threats’
content: Officers remain apprehensive about participating in the new SIR process citing safety issues and hindrance in work caused by various “political factions”

title: Cyclone Montha: SCR Vijayawada division cancels 54 trains
content: Control rooms set up to ensure round-the-clock monitoring; officials told to monitor bridges, operation of trains and the situation at vulnerable locations

title: Montha intensifies into severe cyclonic storm; IMD issues red alert for coasts of Andhra, Odisha
content: Heavy to very heavy rains with isolated extremely heavy rainfall are likely in the districts of Tirupati, SPSR Nellore, Prakasam, Bapatla, Krishna, Guntur, NTR, Palnadu and North Coastal Andhra Pradesh

title: Devotees offer morning prayers at ghats across Bihar on last day of Chhath Puja
content: The devotees gathered on the banks of the Ganga and other water bodies in Patna since early morning to offer ‘Usha Arghya’ to the rising sun

title: Cyclone ‘Montha’: APSRTC on high alert, emergency measures in place
content: Officials have been instructed to avoid unnecessary operations and cancel night-halt services in areas expected to be affected by the cyclone

title: Cloudy sky fails to dim devotion in Hyderabad as prayers offered to rising sun on Chhath Puja’s last day
content: Despite the cloudy skies delaying the sunrise, devotees stood patiently in waist-deep water with baskets of fruits and soop (offerings) in hand

title: Why do cyclones move towards land? | Explained
content: If the global geography were reversed or if the trade winds blew the other way, cyclones would rarely make landfall

title: Traffic diversions in Hyderabad’s Yousufguda for Telugu film industry federation meeting on October 28
content: Moderate traffic congestion is anticipated in and around the Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Indoor  stadium from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

title: Is the Dogri language losing resonance in India?
content: Is the Dogri language declining at the same rate across rural and urban landscapes in the Jammu region?

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: INDIA bloc manifesto to make Bihar number one State, says Tejashwi
content: Congress leader and LoP in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi will join the election campaign in Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga districts on October 29

title: Heavy metals in Cauvery fish, study warns against regular intake
content: While occasional fish consumption may not pose immediate threats, prolonged exposure could lead to cumulative non-carcinogenic and carcinogenic risks

title: Kangana gets bail in defamation case, says regrets 'misunderstanding', respects every mother
content: The defamation case stems from a retweet the actor made with her own comment on Mahinder Kaur, the 73-year-old complainant from Bahadurgarh Jandian village in Punjab's Bathinda district

title: Most people extradited to India are economic offenders: data
content: More than a third (35%) of those extradited to India since 2002 were accused of financial fraud, cheating, and forgery

title: Cyclone Montha LIVE updates: Red alert across Andhra, Odisha coasts, thousands evacuated
content: Cyclone ‘Montha’ has triggered heavy to very heavy rains and strong winds across several districts, disrupting normal life

title: Woman doctor's death in Satara: Family demands SIT, trial in Beed court
content: The complaints made by the woman doctor in the past were not heeded, and a fresh inquiry should be held into them, said a relative

title: After Losing Power, KCR's Party Received Rs 15 Crore Donations Last Year
content: The Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), which was routed in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections, received a little over Rs 15 crore in donations during the last financial year.

title: Chhath Puja Festival Witnesses Trade Worth Over Rs 50,000 Crore: Traders' Body
content: The grand festival of Chhath Puja generated trade worth more than Rs 50,000 crore nationwide, according to the Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) on Tuesday.

title: Meta, TikTok Agree To Obey Australia's Under-16 Social Media Ban
content: Tech giants Meta and TikTok said Tuesday they will obey Australia's under-16 social media ban but warned the landmark laws could prove difficult to enforce.

title: 4-Day Chhath Puja Concludes With 'Usha Arghya' Across India
content: The four-day festival of Chhath Puja concluded on Tuesday with the rising sun (Usha Arghya), as devotees across the country offered their heartfelt prayers to Lord Surya and Chhathi Maiya.

title: Charlie Kirk's Killer Won't Be In Prison Clothes At Trial. Here's Why
content: A Utah judge on Monday ruled that the 22-year-old alleged killer of US conservative activist Charlie Kirk may wear street clothes during his trial, instead of prison attire, over concerns of biasing the jury.

title: From Rs 15-Crore Horse To A Rs 23-Crore Buffalo: Showstoppers At Pushkar Fair
content: The annual Pushkar Cattle Fair in Rajasthan is where you find some of India's most expensive livestock.

title: Video: BJP MLA Falls Into Yamuna While Filming Reel On 'Clean' River
content: The previous AAP government and the ruling BJP have been accusing each other of misleading people over the Yamuna's conditions amid Chhath Puja celebrations.

title: Indian-Origin Woman Murdered In Canada, Suspect Likely Fled To India
content: The police said that the body of 27-year-old Amanpreet Saini was discovered with "traumatic injuries" in a park in Lincoln.

title: "Everything Is True": Japan Ex-PM Shinzo Abe's Killer Pleads Guilty
content: Tetsuya Yamagami, 45, stood accused of murder and violations of arms control laws for allegedly using a handmade weapon to shoot dead Japan's longest-serving leader as he gave a speech in July 2022.

title: Meta Launches 'Ghost Posts', Similar To 'Stories' For Threads App
content: Social media giant Meta launched on Monday posts that are automatically archived 24 hours after being uploaded, dubbed "ghost posts," on its Threads app, mimicking a popular feature available on its other platforms.

title: Cyclone Montha Moving Towards Andhra Coast, Landfall This Evening: 10 Points
content: Cyclonic storm "Montha" is moving steadily towards the Andhra Pradesh coast and is expected to make landfall near Kakinada between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam on Tuesday evening.

title: 9 Years After Dhaka Attack, Why Bangladesh Is Welcoming Zakir Naik Now
content: Following the 2016 Dhaka Holey Artisan Bakery terror attack, the Sheikh Hasina government had banned Zakir Naik's Peace TV. The decision was taken after one of the attackers had said that he and his associates were inspired by the rabid speeches made

title: Delhi's First Cloud Seeding Trial Today: When And How It Will Be Done
content: The Delhi government may conduct its first cloud seeding trial today if weather conditions are favourable, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said.

title: Russian drones hunt down, chase out Ukrainian civilians, UN inquiry finds
content: Russia has been chasing civilians who live near the front line in Ukraine with drones, hounding them out of their homes and hunting them down, forcing thousands to flee whole areas in what amounts to a crime against humanity, a UN inquiry found.

title: As Asia-Pacific Leaders Gather In South Korea, A Look At What APEC Is
content: APEC, which was founded in 1989, has 21 members that represent more than 50% of global GDP and are home to some 2.7 billion people, or 40% of the world's population.

title: OpenAI Offers 'ChatGPT Go' Free For 1 Year To Users In India From November 4
content: OpenAI on Tuesday said it will offer 'ChatGPT Go' -- that supports higher query limits and more image generation -- free for one year to users in India who sign up during a limited-time promotional period beginning November 4.

title: Explained: Why Hurricanes Like Melissa Are Becoming More Common
content: Hurricane Melissa has strengthened into a Category 5 cyclone, the highest level on the Saffir-Simpson, where even well-built structures face catastrophic damage.

title: Insurance Agent's Body Found In Faridabad Drain, Woman And Fiance Arrested
content: A woman and her fiance have been arrested in Faridabad near Delhi for allegedly murdering an insurance agent and throwing his body in a drain. The woman has told the police that they murdered the victim, Chander, because he had been blackmailing her.

title: Venezuela Claims CIA 'False Flag' Attack Foiled As US Deploys Bombers
content: Venezuela claimed Monday to have dismantled a CIA-financed cell plotting a false-flag attack on a US warship deployed to the southern Caribbean, as Washington stepped up pressure on Caracas by flying bombers nearby.

title: Will take legal action against EC once in power: Uddhav Thackeray
content: The slew of allegations against the EC has surfaced in Maharashtra ahead of the upcoming local body elections

title: Unseasonal rains push Maharashtra’s onion farmers to indefinite protest
content: Unseasonal rains have devastated onion nurseries across Maharashtra, triggering indefinite farmer protests.

title: Tripura online activist held for “abusing” State govt.
content: Madhavi Biswas, a resident of Pratapgarh in Agartala, has spoken about alleged corruption in the State government and lack of civic amenities.

title: CPI Ministers to boycott Cabinet demanding withdrawal from PM SHRI pact
content: CPI general secretary D. Raja calls Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s reasons for joining the contentious scheme unconvincing.  Kerala government should have taken its cue from Tamil Nadu and moved the Supreme Court for unconditional and obligatory federal funding for education, he says

title: BJP hits out at Opposition over its stand on SIR 2.0
content: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Congress and other Opposition parties are targeting the Election Commission and using the SIR as an excuse for the “impending losses” in the coming polls

title: INDIA bloc to release poll manifesto on October 28; Rahul to join campaign
content: Rahul Gandhi to hold his first election campaign in Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga on October 29; Tejashwi slams the Central government and accuses it of “telling lies” about running special trains during Chhath

title: Congress high command will decide on changing Chief Minister, says Siddaramaiah
content: Amid speculation over the change of leadership and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar’s visit to Delhi, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in Mangaluru reiterated that the Congress high command will take a call on whether or not to continue him as the Chief Minister

title: Muhammad Yunus sparks controversy with controversial map on book presented to Pakistan military general
content: The map in question was printed on the cover of a book that was presented to Chairman of Pakistan’s Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee (CJCSC) General Sahir Shamshad Mirza

title: Experts link fatal mudslip to poor road stability measures in Idukki
content: Experts blame unscientific slope cutting practices for landslips on the the Kochi-Dhanushkodi stretch.

title: Trinamool softens stand on SIR, says will democratically protest if genuine voters are removed
content: The CPI(M) urged transparency in Special Intensive Revision of voter lists, whereas the Congress sought that all-party meetings be convened both at the State and Central level

title: Only God will do justice, says father of Bihar youth jailed for abusing PM during Rahul Gandhi’s Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: Mohammed Rizvi’s only crime is his poor family background, he had been coaxed into committing the mistake, says his father, who runs a small two-wheeler repair shop at Bharwara village; he says the police haven’t given him a copy of the FIR and he lacks the resources to hire a lawyer for his son

title: Odisha deploys disaster response forces to tackle Cyclone Montha
content: All district administrations have been asked to ensure ‘zero casualty’ in the natural disaster, said Suresh Pujari, State Revenue and Disaster Management Minister

title: Chetan and Ajit carry family legacies into Bihar battle
content: Two candidates from the Rajput community have distinct profiles – while one is battling the legacy of a ‘don’, the other is following the footsteps of a man who has never compromised on his ideology

title: Cyclone set to cross coast; red alert in 16 A.P. districts
content: Cyclonic storm Montha is very likely to cross Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada in the evening or night of Oct.28 as a severe cyclonic storm with a maximum sustained wind speed of 90-100 kmph, says IMD; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to ensure that relief reaches the public without delay

title: Voters in rural Bihar still reluctant to rally behind ‘untested’ Jan Suraaj
content: From distrust to disinterest, JSP struggles with low recall and credibility in the State’s hinterlands. However, urban voters who have grievances with the current government but are uncomfortable voting for the Tejashwi Yadav-led Grand Alliance, do see Prashant Kishor’s party as an alternative

title: Black hole activities suppress the birth of new stars around it: Study
content: ‘It reveals that both intense radiation from around the black holes as well as the high-speed jets they emit can work together to eject gas from the centres of galaxies, potentially shutting down star formation in their central regions and regulating galactic growth.

title: T.N. will fight any attempt to disenfranchise its people, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: DMK and its allies have called for an all-party meeting on the SIR of electoral rolls on November 2. The leaders alleged that the functioning of the EC was not only controversial but also suspicious

title: Digital arrest is one of the most dreaded threats to citizens: President Murmu
content: Addressing Indian Police Service probationers, the President referred to the growing trend of fraudsters impersonating law enforcement officers, and extorting money by threatening victims with arrest or the freezing of bank accounts

title: Election Commission modifies some SIR rules after Bihar
content: No documents are to be collected from electors during the Enumeration Phase, the ECI said in a notice issued to the Chief Electoral Officers of the 12 States and Union Territories where the SIR will be carried out next

title: Navy’s top maritime forum, the Indo-Pacific Regional Dialogue 2025, opens today
content: The IPRD 2025 aims to strengthen multilateral cooperation, promote regional stability, and advance the shared vision of a resilient and prosperous Indo-Pacific

title: Japanese PM Takaichi faces her first big diplomatic test with Trump talks
content: The meeting will be watched closely in Delhi for any clarity between the two leaders on India’s plans to host the delayed Quad summit; the visit to Japan comes just before Trump’s meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in South Korea

title: Well-prepared for SIR in Kerala, says Kelkar
content: Steps being taken to avoid ‘dual duty’ trouble for officers as SIR coincides with 2025 local body polls, says Rathan Kelkar

title: Chief Information Commissioner appointments in 'two or three' weeks, Centre tells SC
content: “The best way to kill the RTI is to not make any appointments… If they do make appointments, they select persons out of the blue. Names are just air-dropped. There is no information on who is being appointed,” said Prashant Bhushan.

title: SC raps Delhi police for delay in filing response to bail pleas of 2020 riots accused
content: The top court said most of the accused in the larger 2020 Delhi riots conspiracy case have already spent nearly five years in custody

title: IRCTC scam case: Lalu Yadav, Rabri Devi ask Delhi court not to conduct day-to-day trial
content: Say day-to-day hearings are happening in three other cases and ask for time to read the chargesheet and court order

title: CM okays land for railway coaching terminals at Amaravati, Gannavaram
content: Chandrababu Naidu orders immediate release of ₹27 crore for next phase of work on new Nadikudi-Srikalahasti railway line, moots Integrated Logistics Park, high-speed elevated railway corridors on Hyderabad-Bengaluru and Hyderabad-Chennai routes via Amaravati

title: Fill vacant posts in agricultural institutes, Chouhan tells ICAR, States
content: The Union Minister stressed the need to develop agriculture-related educational infrastructure and enable self-reliance

title: Three-day national conference of school boards in Hyderabad from Oct. 29
content: Delegates ranging from chairpersons of school boards and policy experts, to representatives from international affiliates such as Cambridge and the International Baccalaureate (IB) will be present to share knowledge on assessment reforms, quality assurance, skill education and digital learning ecosystems

title: Dodgers win WS classic on Freeman's HR in 18th
content: Freddie Freeman homered leading off the bottom of the 18th inning, Shohei Ohtani went deep twice in another record-setting performance and the Dodgers outlasted the Blue Jays 6-5 in Game 3 on Monday night to win a World Series classic.

title: Springer exits with injury; Jays await MRI results
content: Blue Jays designated hitter George Springer left Game 3 of the World Series after suffering an injury on a swing in the top of the seventh inning Monday night.

title: Flagg hurts shoulder, is benched in crunch time
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg injured his left shoulder on the opening possession of Monday night's loss and spent the vast majority of crunch time watching from the bench due to a coach's decision.

title: Kelce ties Chiefs TD mark with vintage night
content: Travis Kelce led the Chiefs to a comfortable win over the Commanders with six receptions on eight targets for 99 yards -- and his 83rd career touchdown, which tied former running back Priest Holmes for the most total touchdowns in franchise history.

title: Markkanen 1st Jazz player to top 50 since Malone
content: Lauri Markkanen scored a career-high 51 points, the first Jazz player to reach 50 in the regular season since Karl Malone in 1998, and Utah beat Phoenix 138-134 in overtime Monday night.

title: Sources: Broncos CB Surtain expected out weeks
content: Broncos cornerback Pat Surtain II is expected to miss multiple games with a left pectoral strain and could be a candidate for injured reserve, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Maxey, Edgecombe off to historic start for Sixers
content: Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe have combined for 186 points, the most by a starting backcourt in a team's first three games of a season since 1970-71.

title: Grant-Foster granted injunction to play for Zags
content: Tyon Grant-Foster, whose appeal for an eligibility waiver was denied by the NCAA earlier this month, has been granted a preliminary injunction by a Spokane County judge.

title: 🏈 Top NFL players who could be traded
content: Here's how the top trade candidates -- including Trey Hendrickson, Chris Olave and even Mark Andrews -- stack up. Who is the top target to land before Nov. 4?

title: Sports' mafia ties run deeper than NBA gambling scandal
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

title: Barnwell makes sense of a blowout-filled Week 8: One key takeaway from each of Sunday's 11 games
content: Ten of Sunday's games were two-score wins -- not super exciting. But we still found something fun in every matchup, including some RB takeovers.

title: Justin Fields won't get benched? Myles Garrett is DPOY? Let's overreact to Week 8
content: We sized up Week 8 overreactions, including fantasy. Is Fields on more solid ground? Will Garrett be the DPOY?

title: What Carson Wentz's injury means for Vikings, J.J. McCarthy
content: Wentz proved to be a warrior, playing through a serious injury, but now it's time to see what McCarthy can do.

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.
